flashcards.english: Too many buffaloes do not have meat (Deal with one thing at a time)
flashcards.notes: Cultural meaning: 'It is not easy to handle a large herd' or 'Narrow down to one item at a time'. Teaches focus and avoiding overwhelm. Grammar: Nyingĩ (many), Itirĩ (they do not have - negative), Ndĩrĩ (I don't have), Ndũrĩ (you don't have)

flashcards.kikuyu: Kūrīha nyūmba ūtegūcererwo tigītūmikīega gīa kuongerera nyūmba
flashcards.english: Paying rent on time is not a good reason to increase the amount of rent
flashcards.notes: Modern social commentary on housing and tenant rights. Addresses fairness in rental practices. Shows application of traditional wisdom patterns to contemporary issues
